predicate.note: Frames file for 'entice' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 31.1, other framed members include comfort, convince, depress, encourage, exhaust, interest, reassure, repel, scare, shock, spook, threaten, and worry. Framenet entry Suasion1. Comparison with attract.

role.descr: thing attracted to, if separate from attractor

example.name: entice into
example.text: The major question, said one holder who asked not to be named, is whether New York investor Bennett S. LeBow, whose Brooke Partners controls Western Union, is willing to offer a large enough equity stake *trace* to entice bondholders into agreeing to a new swap.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But there was a dearth of sellers, traders said, so buyers had to bid prices up *trace* to entice them.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: Mary enticed John with a six-pack of spiked Kool-Aid.
